The most recent version of Ubuntu comes installed with a wide range of software including [[OpenOffice.org|OpenOffice]], [[Firefox]], [[Pidgin (software)|Pidgin]], [[Transmission (BitTorrent client)|Transmission]], and [[GIMP]]. Several lightweight [[card game|card]], [[Computer puzzle game|puzzle]], and [[board game]]s are pre-installed, such as [[Sudoku]] and [[chess]]. Ubuntu has all [[TCP and UDP port|networking ports]] closed by default for added security; its [[firewall]] offers [[Granularity|fine-grained]] control of incoming and outgoing connections. GNOME 2.22âthe default desktop environment of Ubuntu 8.04âoffers support for 46 languages.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://library.gnome.org/misc/release-notes/2.22/#rni18|title=GNOME 2.22 Release Notes - Internationalization|accessdate=2008-06-02|publisher=[[GNOME Foundation]]}}</ref> There are several ways to install Ubuntu, outlined below.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://releases.ubuntu.com/8.04/|title=Ubuntu 8.04 (Hardy Heron)|accessdate=2008-06-02|publisher=Canonical Ltd. }}</ref>
The most recent version of Ubuntu comes installed with a wide range of software including [[OpenOffice.org|OpenOffice]], [[Firefox]], [[Pidgin (software)|Pidgin]], [[Transmission (BitTorrent client)|Transmission]], and [[GIMP]]. Several lightweight [[card game|card]], [[Computer puzzle game|puzzle]], and [[board game]]s are pre-installed, such as [[Sudoku]] and [[chess]]. Ubuntu has all [[TCP and UDP port|networking ports]] closed by default for added security; its [[firewall]] offers [[Granularity|fine-grained]] control of incoming and outgoing connections. GNOME 2.22âthe default desktop environment of Ubuntu 8.04âoffers support for 46 languages.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://library.gnome.org/misc/release-notes/2.22/#rni18|title=GNOME 2.22 Release Notes - Internationalization|accessdate=2008-06-02|publisher=[[GNOME Foundation]]}}</ref> There are several ways to install Ubuntu, outlined below.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://releases.ubuntu.com/8.04/|title=Ubuntu 8.04 (Hardy Heron)|accessdate=2008-06-02|publisher=Canonical Ltd. }}</ref>
â
Ubuntu may also run several programs designed for [[Microsoft Windows]], through [[Wine (software)|Wine]], such as [[Microsoft Office]].
+
Ubuntu may also run several programs designed for [[Microsoft Windows]], through [[Wine (software)|Wine]] (or a Virtual Machine like [[VMware Workstation]] or [[VirtualBox]]), such as [[Microsoft Office]].
